Sentence: Back in the town of York, Richard's sons Edward and Richard, and his (Edward) follower Montague, urge York to take the throne immediately, rather than await Henry's death
Edward and his (Henry) men burst in and demand the throne
Edward blames Margaret's pride for the civil war, and he (Henry) declares that they will have to argue on the field of battle, since she (Margaret) won't let Henry speak
Henry's son Prince Edward urges him (Edward) to flee
Edward sees he (Edward) has won the battle, though Henry is nowhere to be found
Meanwhile, as Henry wanders through the forest, he (Henry) is arrested by two men who support Edward
Henry's followers go to gather troops to battle Edward
Edward and Richard capture Henry and send him (Edward) to the Tower before they march to meet Warwick's army
And with Henry and his (Henry) son out of the way, Richard's next goal is to eliminate George and Edward
